intro: Erigeron serratus, commonly known as the roughleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are serrated and hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. Erigeron serratus is often found in the eastern and central United States, where it thrives in full sun.
